request_pathways.name: Patient Request for Access to Health Information
Authorization for Release of Medical Information
Fax to Health Information Management department
Mail to Health Information Management department

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a dedicated one-page 'Patient Request for Access to Health Information' form from erlanger.org, prints and fills it by hand, and submits via fax or mail to the HIM department.

red_flags: Patient access form (form-3) implies in-person submission via ID verification section with no clearly stated remote submission option
Bundled sensitive-category consent on general ROI form (form-1) with no opt-out for substance abuse or HIV records
bright_spots: Dedicated patient access form separate from third-party release authorization
Granular record type selection with 18 options across hospital and clinic categories
Plain-language first-person framing throughout the patient access form

findability.rationale: Level 4: All three forms were found via a basic web search with no barriers; a Medical Records page exists under patient tools, though the patient access form URL path is not intuitively navigable.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Form has a text layer enabling PDF annotation workarounds but zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite; fax submission is available system-wide for sending in the completed form.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Single-page form with clear logical flow, plain first-person language, and granular record selection; minor issues include SSN request and an opaque email risk disclaimer referencing an external document.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 4: Erlanger offers a dedicated patient access form clearly distinct from third-party release, with patient-friendly framing, but lacks explicit patient rights language and has an unclear submission process.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Patient access form omits fee disclosure entirely, includes no patient rights statement, and collects partial SSN unnecessarily; general ROI form bundles sensitive-category consent without opt-out.

overall.summary: Erlanger demonstrates above-average patient-centeredness with a dedicated access form and plain language, but non-fillable PDFs, unclear submission instructions, and missing fee disclosure prevent a higher grade.
